title: South Leinster Way Walking Route

images.title: Dylan Moore, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Kildavin village. The start of the South Leinster Way

images.title: Graham Horn / South Leinster Way
images.caption: This road is incorporated into a scenic drive and is also part of the South Leinster Way long distance path. This is looking north towards Croghaun, the most northerly hill of the Blackstairs mountains.

images.title: kevin higgins / Muddy Lane
images.caption: Hikers on muddy lane, part of the South Leinster Way, near Ballyshane.

images.title: Graham Horn / Cattle grid on the South Leinster Way
images.caption: Cattle grid on trail. The square is mainly forested, to the left of the road as it drops down the southern side of Slievebawn.

images.title: Graham Horn / From the South Leinster Way
images.caption: View from the South Leinster Way. Taken from the south-east corner of the square, this shows this square pretty much in its entirety as it drops down from moorland to farmland with a small river valley bisecting it.

images.title: Slieve Bawn by kevin higgins, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Slieve Bawn

images.title: Water pump on the South Leinster Way by Hywel Williams, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Water pump on the trail, County Carlow.

images.title: Humphrey Bolton / The old bridge, Carrick on Suir, Co. Tipperary
images.caption: The old bridge, Carrick on Suir, Co. Tipperary

description: This National Waymarked Trail runs for 104km from Kildavin, County Carlow to Carrick-on-Suir in County Tipperary. Starting from Kildavin you head south west to the Blackstairs Mountains where you will pass Mount Leinster on the border of Counties Carlow and Wexford. You continue to Borris where you will pick up a riverside section along the River Barrow and the Barrow Way. This will take you south to Graiguenamanagh  before continuing to Inistioge where are views of the River Nore. In this area you can also pick up the Woodstock Waterfall Loop Walk which will take you to the Woodstock House Arboretum and Gardens. The next stage takes you through woodland and countryside to Mullinavat before heading west to finish at Carrick-on-Suir on the River Suir.
